Reviews.Title: “Beware unfair billing”
Reviews.Author: Max R
Reviews.Content: The apartments are clean, although a little spartan. Well equipped kitchen. Marlin cheated me out of over 150 pounds. I booked a stay for 6 days, Sunday through Friday. My plans changed and on Tuesday I telephoned the front desk and said I needed to change my check out date to Friday. The clerk said "We have a 72 hour policy, it's Tuesday, so you're within the deadline. I'll take care of it." The next day I got an email from Martin saying they I needed to submit any changes in WRITING, and since I hadn't written, and it was Wednesday, I had missed the deadline. I lost 150 pounds (plus taxes) for a night of lodging I didn't use, even though I notified them and was told by their own representative it was handled. If their agent had said "Please email us" I would have emailed. But he said "I'll take care of it." I read the contract after receiving the email, and it's true it says that notice must be in writing. However, if you called and were told "I'll take care of it" you wouldn't pull out the contract (and a magnifying glass) to verify the terms. They know their own agent took my information and said he handled my request. Yet they used a technicality to basically screw me out of 150 pounds. Can you think of any hotel or business that wouldn't back their own representative who was trying to help?

Reviews.Title: “Planning to return”
Reviews.Author: SerafinaLondon
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at some of the comments of previous visitors. I've stayed at Canary Wharf and Empire Square and each time was impressed with the standard of fittings, the cleanliness and overall design. There might have been one or two minor imperfections but nothing that would prevent me from returning. I reconnoitred the apartments in each location beforehand and the staff couldn't have been more helpful in showing me round. I also think that for larger groups, the 2 bed apartments represent much better value than any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A base for a girls weekend....”
Reviews.Author: Sunny636
Reviews.Content: We booked this serviced apartment to use as a base for a girls trip to London. We actually at no 9 Byng Road and we rented a two bedroom apartment with two bathrooms advertised as ideal for 2-4 persons. The initial booking was made on-line and the process was simple. We did make enquiries as to whether we could have an extra bed (so everyone could have their own bed rather than a couple of us doubling-up), but were quite astrounded that this would be charged at £37 per night - so doubling up it was! The instructions received by email for the check-in process were clear and the directions were good, had it not been for the roadworks at the roundabout where we were instructed to go straight across. When we stayed there were barriers up which force pedestrians down the first exit, Marsh Lane, rather than allow you access to the 2nd, Westferry Road. However we found during the course of the weekend, you can cut through the City Pride Pub car park which allows you to get from Marsh Lane to Westferry Lane without any fuss. It is a good 10 minute walk from CW Tube to Byng Lane. We arrived at the apartment at 6:30 on the Friday and the check-in process was simple and efficient; the concierge was extremely pleasant. We were on the third floor at the front of the building; the building is served by one lift which will accomodate 4 people and luggage (we were 3 and had space to spare!). The apartment itself was spacious and well equipped, with two well sized double bedrooms which had plenty of hanging and drawer space. However, we did have one observation, that as it is marketed as suitable for 2-4 people, there is only sufficient seating for 3 people on what I'd call comfy seating (sofa). There is a table and four chairs, but personally I feel it would have benefitted from having a bigger sofa. Also whilst advertised as a serviced apartment, in the general instructions it was stated that the occupants had to empty the rubbish bins - which seemed to be a contradication. We did as we were asked as we didn't want to risk the £200 credit card swipe we had to provide as part of the check-in process. Not really a big deal but something that kind of irked us! One thing we would draw people's attention to is that as we had a room at the front and it was quite warm, we had the windows open overnight and it was very noisy intermitently between 1am and 2:30am outside in the street (Marlin is opposite a low-rise residental block of flats) with people returning home from a night out. Whilst I can't comment what the noise level is like at the rear of the building, I suspect it wouldn't be any worse than the front, so might be worth asking for a room at the rear of the building to try and minimise any intrusion from outside noise. All in all, a good base for the weekend, easy access to CW tube, the DLR and the Thames Clipper. We did get a taxi back on the Saturday night as we didn't fancy the walk from the tube after a night out and it was about £20 from the Embankment area.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kovan888
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Marlin Apartrments Canary South in Dec 2012.. The apartment is clean and has quite a nice and comfortable interior. I like the complete cooking facility and spaciousness of the apartment. However it is not easy to locate the place and we had to walk quite a distance from Canary Wharf station (with our heavy luggage ) to the hotel. A few people we asked on the way do not seem to know where this hotel is located. The staff is rather unfriendly and aloof and it can feel quite scary to walk back to the hotel along the dimly lit street late at night. At the end of our stay we were told that we would have to 150 pounds for losing the room key as they would need to change the lock! Although this rule was stated in the service agreement in fine print in view of the exorbitant charge, it should be clearly highlighted to us verbally when we check in or in the email booking confirmation. So make sure you don;t lose the key. Most moden hotels and service aparatments have the digital card key system but Marlin Apartments are still fitted with keys. The receptionist merely asked us to sign the form and said that a security deposit of 200 pounds would be deducted from our credit card to pay for any damages. They refused to waive the charges even though the key was misplaced whilst we were in the room and therefore there is no security risk. . We had also assumed wrongly that the service would be as fine and professional as that at Fraser's apartment Canary wharf (which is nearer to the train station and of much better quality in terms of service , furnishing and view).. We had stayed at Fraser's apartment before. However we were truly disappointed with Marlin Apartments.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but inconsistent amenities - but would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviews06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for more than a month - fairly expensive, around 140 to 150 pounds per night (incl vat and credit card fees!). The apartments are managed by Marlin. We made the booking through a company named Silver Door - this was another story. We would not use them again (they showed very nice photos of the apartments on their website, but the reality was far from those photos - so do not pay any attention to the photos!). These serviced apartments are also known as South Quay apartments. The reception is at no. 9 Byng Street, Canary Wharf. We stayed at 2 different apartments: one at 9 Byng St, and one at 11 Byng Street (the building next door). The location of the buildings is handy to Canary Wharf - about 10 to 15 minutes walk to CW tube and DLR, depending on the route. The receptionist told us to turn right where we would walk along the main roads to CW. However, we later discovered an alternate route, which was quieter, by turning left which took us through the foot bridge into CW (our preferred route). The room size was reasonable and had underfloor heating (positive). While the room was well furnished, the furniture and bedding were so dated and would need to be refurbished. The bathroom has the shower over the bath. The water pressures for the shower were very weak to have a normal shower. It was hard to control the mixed temperatures - water either cold or hot! We did not like the shower at all. The underfloor heating for the apt at 11 Byng St did not work in the bathroom, where we would need it most! The lounge / kitchen was well equipped like most serviced apartments - hot plates, oven, microwave, fridge / freezer, washer / dryer, dishwasher, plus kitchen utensils, crockery and cutlery. However, the lounge suite at 9 Byng St was very old and the vinyl was peeling off the sofa. The bedroom was reasonable size, with wardrobe, however, the bed at 9 Byng St was so horrible. It had to be the worst we had slept on. Truly, Marlin needs to put a new mattress in the room we stayed. We could feel every spring on that mattress. It was so thin and worn out. One of us had to sleep on the sofa. The apartment at 9 Byng St was on a higher floor, so it was bright. In contrast, the apartment at 11 Byng St was on a lower floor, so it was very dark - making us feeling very depressed, not seeing much sunshine! The apartment at 9 Byng St had wired internet connection, but the apartment at 11 Byng St had wifi. The internet connection in both buildings was slow, very intermittent and unreliable most days - which was very annoying for us. Overall, our stay at these apartments had not been very comfortable. We read that some reviewers had more positive experience than we did. It could be that they were allocated better rooms? However, we cannot recommend these apartments at all. We stayed there because they were probably among the cheapest? - other apartments in the area were above 150 pounds a night. It is the old saying, you never get more for what you pay and often it is less, much less! Although our stay had not been pleasant, we found the staff at the reception desk (located at 9 Byng St building) were generally polite and occasionally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Canary Wharf Marlin Apartments”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty B
Reviews.Content: Amazing weekend. Marlin Apartments couldnt of asked for a better place to stay. Reception lady was beautifully mannered and welcoming. The apartment it self was stunning with fantastic views! If I could of stayed there longer I would of. Recommend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home for 5 months!!!”
Reviews.Author: PreetiParti
Reviews.Content: great location, secured entrance, great apartments, 9 minute walk away from the canary wharf underground station, very close to Thames, a nice easy stroll away from Asda.. I think I had the best time at Marlin and the same would be the opinion of atleast 10 of our coulleagues who stayed @ Marlin. Not sure about why they got such remarks, but 19 byng street, apartment 20 and another huge 2 room apt on 1st floor are totally worth it. I loved it all, the kitchen, the dining area and my room... We always picked up our immediate groceries from the bangladeshi shop around the corner, decent place to pick things if you dont want to make a trip to Asda. London Marathon 2010 route was right outside..we had a brilliant time watch indeed. We used LAN which was great and created hot spots for my wifi devices such as ipod/phone. The staff was very friendly and even helped me print my boarding pass on a weekend when i had no way out. Clearly a thumbs up for me!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Far from luxury apartments”
Reviews.Author: vladib79
Reviews.Content: I just got back from this apartment yesterday 03/10/11, where I booked studio flat. Let me tell you its just like renting a council flat, there is a charge xtra for basically everything, for example there is parking but you need to pay an xtra £15 per night. When we got to the place there was about 6 or 7 rubbish bags by the lift blocking the way not to mention the smell and that took ages to be cleared, the walls need all around maintenance. The corridor for the flats looks like student hall small and narrow, the cleaner blocked our flat door with her trolley and didn't even come to move it when we called the person staying in the flat came out to move it and apologise saying the cleaner was inside his flat. Every time we went to reception there seemed to be a unhappy customer. Now I don't know if people are aware of this but you can't have a pull down bed and called it a luxury flat and even worse no air con, in the times we live in air con is a must, the room was boiling hot because we were facing the sun and overlooking the estates across the road...nice... We went to reception to ask about it and the smart staff lady said that in England it doesn't get that hot so there is no need for air con, I'm sorry but I live in London and not so far from canary wharf in the past 5 to 10 year it has been very hot during the summer not for the whole of it but in patches. I have paid £100 per night in these supposed luxury flats but if I knew what it would be like I never would. Marlin apartments need a lot of improvements if their to get to luxury status.

Reviews.Title: “The top 10 Facts!”
Reviews.Author: Monty5Melbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marlin apartments after some trepidation from reviews. We had booked the apartment based on its very,very cheap price. 1) It is excellent value for money 2) It is in a safe area 3) It is convenient to the Underground and DLR 4) The Rooms are spacious and clean and well secured 5) Concierge were always available and helpful when we needed them. Not sure about the 24 hour thing, but they seemed to be there when we needed help 6) It is a fair way out of Central London , but this was not a major issue, as Trains are excellent and only 10 minutes away 7) No shops in immediate vicinity but only 5-10 minutes walk to them,as well as to excellent Restaurant options 8) Beware- no WiFi in rooms , but it was available in Reception area. They offer connection if you have the right IT connections , but for dumb IT people like me, no wi-fi in rooms 9)We didn't cook there, but well laid out for cooking 10) Quiet area. If something went wrong though, Fire Brigade only next door!Makes you feel even safer!

Reviews.Title: “Really rather better than some of these reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: timabdelhadytravel
Reviews.Content: I've used this place twice now when needing to be in Canary Wharf and actually found these apartmentsexcellent value for money - certainly compared to neighbouring hotels. They're well-appointed and equipped, comfortable lounge area, excellent kitchen and bathrooms. In sum, everything you need for a short-stay in London. They could probably do without the lengty contract they make you sign on arrival and the taxi company they reccomend will try and charge you a higher price than the one quoted. But other than that I didn't have any quibbles.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and no value for money.”
Reviews.Author: chrisb565
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at these apartments and the weekend just passeed and had to pay a surhcharge of £30 for late checkout. Rude receptionist that morning with a "thats all" attitude and not even "i hope you enjoyed your stay" comment was made. Wouldnt reccommend if your after something where you dont get ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartment, so quiet and central for everything”
Reviews.Author: fransonghurst
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised when we opened our apartment door - lots of space, nice decor, we had everything we needed and all within a stones throw of the station. It was also on a lovely quiet street. I would love to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Annette_H100
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs, broken toilet seat, cold shower on last day, uneven floor boards, the list goes on. What a shame, these spacious, modern apartments could be lovely. My complaint about bed bugs received an apology but my suggestion of compensation was ignored. Would I stay there again - no way! Any tips on how to deal with bed bugs as my clothes are sure to be contaminated?

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: PWhitman
Reviews.Content: First visit to a Marlin property - staying in Canary Wharf on business for a couple of days and decided that I fancied a change from the hotel. First impressions are good however as other reviewers suggest, when you scratch the surface a few problems. Kitchen is well equipped, but one of the overhead cupboard doors was nearly off it's hinges. Sofa has clearly seen better days and there was a slightly odd smell pervading the place. The road the apartments on seems to be a bit of a rat run for taxi's and the double glazing is clearly of the cheap variety. Internet connection was good and the young chap on concierge was very helpful however he was replaced by a female colleague on the second day whose description is best left as "surly"! All in all not perfect and given the competition about, probably not likely to be revisited any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame - it could be made so much better!”
Reviews.Author: Skenners
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many serviced apartments across the Uk this was unfortunately lacking. Almost like someone somewhere read the formula for a great services apartment (luxury fittings, fully equipped kitchen, convenient location, luxury toilettires, cleanliness to the point of obsession) but unfortunately whoever is running this has lost the manual (ok fittings, kitchen adequate, location great for business but a definate no go for tourists, toiletires that look like they have been 'topped up' with something a little cheaper, filthy sofa and lounge rug and floors that could do with at really good clean right to the corners) it wouldn't much to make this a brilliant business location but until it sees some are and attention i won't be back. P.s i wasn't supposed to be staying here, i wulnd't have chosen it given the other reviews but got move here when the apartment I did book boiler broke.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: MrsVG1
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at Marlin Apmts Canary South this week, arrived to find the heating controls at 35 degrees and so was ridiculously hot. Woke the following morning to find the bed full of bed bugs..........how absolutely disgusting. He killed about 10 and they were full of blood..........presumably his. The bugs were all over the pillows, bedlinen and headboard. He was really angry and upset by this. We have travelled the world extensively and never...never....seen bed bugs. To make matters worse, no interest was taken by his complaint when checking out (very early) next day. Having now researched bed bugs, I realise how difficult to get rid of and so after bathing extensively when he got home late the following night, the next morning we have had to wash and clean all our bedding at home, discarded some of his clothes and left the rest and luggage he was travelling with, in the garage hoping the freezing temperatures will kill off any that had sneaked into his bags etc. How disgusting, we suggest you avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay...”
Reviews.Author: Seamus035
Reviews.Content: Wanted somewhere somewhere nice and close to where I was working for a few a days in London without the hassle of a hotel so when I browsed the internet I found a great deal through Marlin apartments. Booked a one bedroomed in Canary Wharf. Loved everything about the apartment, immaculate, wonderfully furnished, really comfortable and fab welcome pack of goodies! Apartments are very secure with everything to hand. Best nights sleep for ages. Definitely will stay in Marlin apartments in preference to London hotels and will recommend to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious 2-bedroom apartments but need maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Cupak
Reviews.Content: Misinformed by email concerning need for lockbox code to be forwarded by follow-up email which never arrived. In fact that system had been superseded and a concierge was in place but we only found out the hard way, arriving in London to find no email with code info. Had to go to another Marlin property (with concierge) to get into this property. Had to switch apartments due to unusable cooktop. First apartment had very stained carpet, second apt. had loose tiles in bathroom floor, chipped cooktop, large tear in sofa. Beds average. Overall good apartments but must attend to maintenance issues. Expensive per night in July but typical for London.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all the reviews are scary, but the apartments are really good...”
Reviews.Author: krayonDelhi
Reviews.Content: Good, nice clean apartments, just what you want after a long day at the office and a 10 minute walk from DLR / Jubilee line tube station... Not difficult to locate by Taxi either... A late night corner store nearby too, a pub nearby...warm and cozy apartment with all basics in place, tea / coffee etc. dishwasher, washing machine, iron and iron board, tv, lots of electrical outlets etc. etc.

Reviews.Title: “LIARS and rip-off merchants. NEVER book to stay here. You have been warned!”
Reviews.Author: Pyongyang
Reviews.Content: I was booked to stay here for 1 month at the Malin Canary South apartments. I ended up staying two nights and have thankfully now been relocated (after much hassle) to a far superior dwelling. On arrival, around 11pm after a long day travelling with two large, heavy suitcases and a messenger bag, I was greeted by the night concierge who took ID and made me sign a check-in form. I was then handed the keys to my studio (Apartment 24 in 11 Byng Street) and was left to my own devices. No welcome pack was given to me and I was not offered any help with my bags. Incidentally, when I arrived, the apartments are directly across the road from a block of council flats. At the time I arrived 5 people were lined up, handcuffed next to a riot van ready to be taken to jail. The whole area looked very unsafe at night. Arriving in apartment 24, I was immediately disappointed. The balcony door had been left open so the apartment was FREEZING COLD. I went to close the door but found the door was broken and would not lock. Not only is this poor form but also incredibly dangerous when so close to street level in terms of security. Further investigation of the apartment revealed further problems. The Sky digital card had expired so had a constant error message on screen asking to replace the card or lose viewing. The trash can in the kitchen area was in pieces and broken. The kitchen surfaces were grubby along with grubby walls, floors and light fixtures. I did find my welcome pack in the kitchen though, a half drunk bottle of Malin Apartments mineral water. Nice! I went downstairs to the concierge, asking to be moved to another apartment. After checking I wasn't lying to him by coming up and checking my room he agreed to relocate me to apartment 13. Bare in mind it's late now, around 12:30am. He showed me round, it appeared to be far better than #24. Then he left, leaving me to lock the door. The door wouldn't lock properly from the inside! I called the concierge back, he fiddled with the lock so much that the next door neighbour came out and complained (it was now around 1:30am). It ended up with him locking me in my apartment and feeding the keys through the letter box announcing he'd see it was fixed the next day! Inspecting #24 before bed, I found power sockets on the walls were loose and actually coming off the wall. The walls and floors and kitchens were again sticky and grubby. The radiator in #24 bathroom was also coming off the wall so I dare not touch it in case it fell! On top of all that, the broadband internet in both apartments not only was NOT wireless but the ethernet cable in 13 did not work (lucky I had my own!) but the supposed 'high speed' was none existant. It was worse than a 33.6 baud modem connection! Now it gets interesting. The next morning I explained to work that I wanted out of such a dingy hole of a building. Work agreed to relocate me and found me a much better apartment elsewhere in London. HOWEVER, I had to check out yesterday before 2pm else I would be charged an extra days stay. I arrived at 1:45pm and rather than grabbing my bags immediately and THEN checking out, I explained to the lady on concierge that I was checking out immediately. She said all I need do is hand back my keys as I never made the booking. I grabbed my things and handed the keys in at 1:58pm. I know this to be true as I have email evidence showing I contacted work to inform them exactly the time I checked out, with timestamps. You'd think all would be well. Well no, no it is not. Malin Apartments notified my work stating that the concierge at Canary South TOLD MARLIN that I checked out at 3:30PM AND WOULD INCUR A FURTHER NIGHT STAY ON MY INVOICE! LIARS! BLATANT LIARS! I have CCTV footage as proof and a witness statement to back it up that I arrived at my place of work WELL BEFORE 3:30PM when they told Marlin that I checked out. Right now I am still wrestling for a refund and an apology. I would recommend NOBODY ever EVER book ANYTHING through Marlin. They are LIARS. The Canary South apartments are dirty, badly managed and VASTLY overpriced for what they are. They are also in a rather rough looking area and convey absolutely NONE of the image they conjour up on their website. STEER WELL CLEAR. Do yourself a favour and book somewhere, anywhere else but this dump. Avoid Marlin at all costs, save yourself time and headaches and you'll find a far better deal out there with a far more reputable and HONEST company.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place with AWFUL service- dont waste your time.”
Reviews.Author: traveltasticLondon
Reviews.Content: The room was booked on the day, and at the time of booking I specifically asked if the room had air conditioning, and I was told that although it didn’t “we have very large windows that are opened in advance of your arrival and so the room will be nice and cool” (it was a very hot day). I booked a studio suite at the Marlin South Canary at a rate of £120 for the night. Upon arrival, I was allocated Appt. 41 in building 9 Byng Street. When I entered the room I noticed it was very warm and the only window in the entire apartment would only open about 5cm in a diagonal fashion, rather than opening fully outwards. As the evening progressed, the room became even hotter. The bathroom was also very stuffy and we discovered that this was as a result of the mirror being heated internally, perhaps to prevent condensation. However on a hot day, in a room with a window that only opens a crack, this is definitely not suitable. At roughly 11pm, the temperature in the room was no longer bearable, at which point I went down to the reception in 9 Byng Street to ask the person on duty if there was any way to open the window any further or if there was any help that could be provided. There was a gentleman at the desk, and I told him the room we were staying in and told him it was very hot and asked if there was anything that could be done. He responded by asking “would you like a fan?” and when I said yes, he responded almost immediately saying “actually sorry they are all given out to other guests”. So why offer me something which you cannot provide?! I then said is there any way the window can open further, to which he replied “no sorry, I know that room’s window does not open very much as a previous guest has also had the same problem and complained about the heat”. I was amazed to hear this and found it shocking that if this issue has been previously brought to the attention of management, and it was a night that was known to be hot, why were we allocated that room? I went for a walk outside for a few minutes to cool down and get away from the heat of the room (after 11pm). During this walk I went to a store and bought some cold bottles of water, however when I returned to the room, we discovered that these could not be kept cold for very long as the refrigerator was broken. We tried to sleep but it was just too hot and we felt like we were in a sauna. At 1am we decided to try and go to another hotel but at that point we realised it would be tough to find another room nearby as it was so late. So we slept very little because of the heat and had an extremely uncomfortable night. The room was still very hot in the morning and the entire stay was very substandard. A fundamental point of any hotel stay is the quality of comfort and sleep your guests get, but we got hardly any sleep due to the conditions in the room. I am amazed at the fact that guests had previously complained about the heat issue in that room, however it was still allocated to us for that night, which was known to be very hot, and on top of that we were told at the time of booking that all rooms had “lovely large windows”! When i checked out, I told the duty manager about our experiences, and she herself recommended that I complain officially and ask for a refund. However when I wrote an e-mail about our experiences, I had to continually chase up a response from the manager called Ian. After repeated attempts to contact him he told me that they were unable to offer me a refund as there was nothing wrong with the room. He asked if i could remember the name of the staff member who had taken my reservation and told me the room would be cool. I wasnt aware that I needed to take staff names when making bookings?! As I couldnt remember the name, he told me that noone admitted saying this to me, and "based on the evidence", my claim for a refund given that Marlin had misrepresented their room quality was denied. Its not surprising that the staff service was so poor when the manager himself is so incompetent and basically calls his dissatisfied customers liars! I cant get my money back but i definitely wouldnt want anyone else to waste their money by staying here. Stay at the Radisson in the wharf instead, same price, much nicer and actually has AC and polite staff!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, unsafe and crowded - I would not recommend this accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: LouiseSwindon
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Canary Wharf South apartments on Saturday 16/05/09 for one night only having paid £185.00 through 'Last Minute'. When we arrived there was one bath towel and small hand towel despite the booking stating that it was for three adults. There was also no welcome and we had no understanding of how to 'book in' until we rang the main office line and was subsquently advised what to do. The towel situation was rectified however, on our arrival back to the apartments (we went to a concert at the O2 arena) we were greeted by a large number of youths who were 'hanging out' in the stair well. The security door to the apartments was faulty and was therefore accessible to anyone. The youths were aggressive to my friends and I and were clearly intoxicated as there were cans of beer and crisp packets strewn all over the staircase. At one point, a youth threatened my partner with physical violence after he had asked them to move out of the way in order to allow us to retreat to our room. Throughout the night, we were subjected to excessive noise (swearing and shouting) and doors banging. We attempted to contact the duty manager (by their extension) and main reception number several times throughout the night but received no answer. We did contemplate calling the police but as the large group of youths were outside our apartment door all night we were fearful of reprecussions. At 8am, we were disturbed again by a youth asking us whether we had a mop as he had been asked by a staff member to clean up the hallway. The staff member was in the hallway and we asked if we could see the manager as none of us had slept all night. The staff member promised to get the manager. Two and a half hours later, we had not seen the manager and tried to telephone again but without success. In addition to this, we had no hot water therefore, none of us could bathe/shower before we left. We left London very tired and unhappy with the whole experience. It felt very unsafe in the middle of the night and we had no one to contact although I appreciate we could have phoned the police. This is the first and last time I use Marlin apartments and I would not recommend this accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: meluk2474
Reviews.Content: As we entered the apartments, the check-in was fine with the codes/lockbox very clear instructions. As we looked around our penthouse, on the balcony there was still wine glasses on the floor and beer cans that had'nt been cleaned up. The rest of the apartment was clean. At first I was disappointed with the size of the 'biggest apartment' in the block as it was the penthouse. We had paid £250 a night and it didn't seem worth it until I recently stayed in a normal hotel room and I can appreciate the size now. However, there is no furniture ie chairs/tables on the balcony. I was Very disappointed with the location. If you want to travel by public transport to sightsee..this is NOT the apartments for you. You not only have to ge the tube, you need to pay extra everyday for the DLR ( docklands railway service) as there is no tube nearby. The DLR is also hard to find and it a good 15 min walk. There are a few local shops & takeaways near by which are OK but no where to eat out as such. There is a small local supermarket where you can pick up essentials. Our view from the 'top' penthouse looked like a construction site. There is alot of work & building going on around the whole area. It was very noisy from early morning until late afternoon, even on the Sunday. The nearest general surroundings are blocks of flats. These are residential flats and lets just say they're 'council estates'. We spotted a few groups of youths around outside when on our balcony at night. To sum it up, our stay was a good experience with the exception of the location, which connot be helped.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst!!”
Reviews.Author: heparUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at Canary Wharf so booked Canary South apartments through Marlin. What a disappointment. It is not far from the center of Canary Wharf but in a dubious location, not for walking at night alone. No concierge, dustbins to greet us at fhe front entrance and dirty lobby with papers strewn about. The apartment was no better, with kitchen furniture broken, carpets and curtains stained, windows broken, even the hairdryer was broken. Customer service is non-existent. I have been trying to get a reply from them now for 4 days but they are not capable of returning calls. If you want to book an apartment with Marlin, I would recommend you look elsewhere. I have stayed in numerous serviced apartments in London and these were the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Marlin Apartments”
Reviews.Author: oonHampshire
Reviews.Content: Wanted a nice weekend in London without the hassle of a hotel so opted for a Marlin Apartment - [--] found website really easy to use, great choice of locations. Booked a one bedroomed in Empire Square, decided to walk there after a trip on the London Eye, as it was a great chance to enjoy the activities along the River Thames. Collected our key, loved everything about the apartment, immaculate, wonderfully furnished, really comfortable and fab welcome pack of goodies, even fresh milk! Spent great time wandering around Borough Market. Concierge booked taxi for evening to go into the city, then we walked most the way back as it was such a nice evening. Apartments are very secure with everything to hand. Best nights sleep for ages. Definitely will stay in Marlin apartments in preference to London hotels and will recommend to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful apartment”
Reviews.Author: dollyhampshire
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed by my stay at: the Marlin Apartments, Empire Square, London Bridge, 34 Long Lane, London, SE1 4NH on Saturday and Sunday. I wanted to rave about it on this website. The luxury apartments were spacious, beautifully decorated, with a lovely personal touch of a welcome pack for the Kitchen and lovely Moulton Brown beauty products and booklet information. I would thoroughly recommend the apartment which I will definitely use again. Well Done to Marlin Apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: wexnz
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the comments of the other guest who gave the apartments a 1 star rating. These apartments are terrible and sooo not worth the price. They are boiling hot and there is no AC. After complaining for 4 days (it was so hot we couldn't sleep - and it wasn't even hot outside!) we finally got given one fan which just made it bearable. The water heating also is terrible, sometimes there is no hot water at all and even when there is it goes from hot to cold in the shower all the time. Having a shower is a total accident risk as the shower is over the bath and there is no mat or handles and it is completely slippery, I almost fell over several times. I hate to think what it would be like for an elderly person. The concierge is hardly ever available. When our room was serviced (which only happens once a week) we were left with 1 towel - for both of us for a week! It took two days to get more. And although there is a kitchen with dishwasher and washing machine there is no washing up liquid, dishwasher powder or washing powder. I could go on and on but that is probably enough.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to leave”
Reviews.Author: midnighttosix
Reviews.Content: While the apartments look decent from afar, I found that they were extremely uncomfortable and badly looked after. We stayed at Canary South, which despite being close to Canary Wharf, was not in a very good area. In fact there was even a police incident just outside the door during our stay! I didn't feel comfortable walking home at night. There were often kids shouting and arguments going on just outside our window. The water heating was terrible. At first we couldn't get anything between freezing cold and boiling hot water in our shower. When we complained they "fixed" it so we couldn't get any hot water at all for the remainder of our stay! When we informed the management, they told us that there was nothing wrong with the water! The building is really hot and muggy, and except for the door in the living room, the windows barely open to let air in. We were given a fan but it hardly helped. I wouldn't recommend Marlin apartments to anyone. We have stayed at Canary Riverside for a similar price, and it was the lap of luxury in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Great Promotion!”
Reviews.Author: Well-travelled-Girl1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for Valentines' weekend as they ran a special price promotion. It is rare to find a company that really goes the extra mile, but Marlin did. The welcome pack was lovely, the Molton Brown toiletries were divine and the bed was so comfy! I have stayed in other apartments but none that had free broadband, and a good SKY tv package. It is SO close to Canary Wharf itself, literally five minute walk - it was just perfect for everything we needed and wanted! Thanks Marlin - Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Home From Home”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler33
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Marlin Apartments recently after booking a day spa at the Sanctury, the apartment was home from home the views were spectacular over london the apartment was warm inviting the furnishings were comfortable, very clean and all well presented down to the finishing touches, everything was laid out so perfectly could not fault it would highly recommend it the only dissapointment was we had to go home, we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Badly managed”
Reviews.Author: Memsahib
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a shortstay apartment in Canary Wharf last year I tried to get the same one again but sadly it was not available. As I wanted free broadband there was not much choice and I agreed to take a near-new apartment in Canary South. Before the managing agents would accept my booking I had to sign and fax back a contract that agreed to give one month's notice if I had to cancel. I had to pay a deposit and there was a 5% surcharge for using Amex and 3% for Visa or MC. I only needed 6 nights. Finally it was agreed that I had complied with all the RULES and was emailed confirmation which told me check-in time was 3pm. Check out time was 9am. I was to get to the apartments and enter a code to get in and anothercode in a box to get my key. My plane from Australia arrived midday and I arrived at the apartments by taxi just after 2.30pm. Ok... so I got past the first door into a small entry with boxes on the wall. I found my box, put in the code and there was no key. No seat, no concierge, no where to put my luggage. A pager number but no phone - and my Australian mobile phone wasn't active. Although exhausted after 24 hours travel I had to wait it out until the magical 3pm. A lady came down in the lift and I asked if she could advise me who would be putting the key in the box. She was the housekeeper but needed to call the pager. She got no response. I wouldn't let her go!! She kept trying the pager number and finally got authority to give me my key. The apartment was pleasantly furnished and the broadband worked well. There was no dressing table in the bedroom and the only place with a power point and mirror for drying hair was in the lounge. The instructions for all the equipment was well set out and easy to follow. The shower was over the bath with a folding glass screen. There was no non-slip mat in the bath and no handles to hold onto getting in and out of the very steep bath. This would not be suitable for elderly people… not really safe for anyone. The towels were small. No corkscrew or salt and pepper shakers. A very strange welcome pack that included Cornflakes, tea and coffee but no milk. While staying there I emailed the managers with my concerns and suggestions. I was as good as told no one else had complained and that they would look into a dressing table in the bedroom for future developments. No thanks for my feedback about the slippery bath. I won’t stay at Canary South Apartments managed by Marlin Apartments again. A pity because it is very convenient to the Canary Wharf shopping complex and tube station and with a few refinements and better management could have become a regular home away from home for my yearly London visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Marlin Apartments Canary South
HotelInfo.Address: 11 Byng Street, Westferry Road, London E14 8GG, England
